data.overview: Chile Atacama rewards pre-dawn starts, wide-brimmed hats, and strategic siestas. Plan short bursts outside with cooling breaks indoors to dodge the brutal mid-day sun.

top_sights.title: Chile Atacama dune ridge sunrise
top_sights.why_go: Golden light and long shadows make the dunes photogenic while temps are manageable.

top_sights.title: Oasis caravan stop
top_sights.why_go: Palm groves with fresh water resupply and local guides sharing navigation tips.

top_sights.title: Chile Atacama star field camp
top_sights.why_go: Dry air delivers clear constellations; many camps include astronomy briefings.

food_highlights.where_to_try: Family tents near the main oasis

seasonality.pros: Best for treks and comfortable camping
Dates harvest festivals and lighter crowds

local_tips: Carry at least 3L of water per person and stash electrolytes for dune climbs.
Pack a scarf or buff to block blowing sand and use breathable long sleeves for sun.
Check CL-visa and desert permit rules; many protected zones require ranger clearance.
safety: Avoid hiking alone; dunes shift quickly and phones lose signal in basins.
Flag convoy location with lodging before long drives and note kilometer markers.
Respect wildlife tracks—snakes and scorpions cool under rocks after sunset.

transport.from_airport: Shared 4x4 transfers run from the nearest regional airport; book ahead for dawn arrivals.
transport.getting_around: Guided convoys and camel shuttles connect dunes with oasis villages.
transport.passes: No transit passes; arrange ranger permits for protected ergs.
